title: Aluminum Price Hits Three-Year High at $2,920/Tonne
summary: Aluminum prices surged to a three-year high of $2,920 per tonne due to China's state-imposed production caps limiting supply amid rising global demand. The price momentum reflects sustained buying pressure and supply disruptions including energy costs and infrastructure bottlenecks.

title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News - Trading Economics
summary: Aluminum prices rose to $2,856.95 per tonne on November 7, 2025, marking a 0.45% daily increase and an 8.63% rise year-over-year. Prices are expected to reach $2,918.78 by the end of the quarter and $3,053.09 in 12 months, driven by tight supply and China's output caps.

title: Aluminum Prices Reach Highest Level Since May 2022
summary: Aluminum futures on the London Metal Exchange rose to $2,902 per metric ton, the highest since May 2022, fueled by tightening supply in China and improving demand outlook amid easing trade tensions. The rally is supported by China's production caps and a recovering construction and consumer goods demand.

title: Aluminum prices are soaring along with copper as demand for ...
summary: Aluminum prices reached nearly $2,900 per tonne, the highest in about three and a half years, driven by soaring demand related to AI and power infrastructure amid easing US-China tensions. Aluminum is increasingly used as a substitute for copper due to copper's high prices.

title: Column: Funds amass record bull bets on aluminum as market narrative turns
summary: Investor funds have accumulated record bullish positions on aluminum amid supply shortages and elevated US Midwest premiums, which have reached an all-time high of $0.89 per pound. US tariffs and sanctions on Russian aluminum have fragmented supply chains, increasing premiums and driving metal flows toward the US market.

title: Investors Amass Record Bull Bets on Aluminium Supply Shortage
summary: Record investment surges in aluminum reflect structural supply shortages amplified by US tariffs and EU sanctions on Russian aluminum. The US Midwest premium hit $1,938 per ton, 67% above the LME price, indicating tight supply and depleted inventories ahead of tariff hikes.

title: Century Aluminum Q3 2025 slides: Sequential growth amid missed expectations
summary: Century Aluminum reported sequential progress in Q3 2025 despite missing expectations. The company is advancing a new smelter project expected to take 4-6 years and create over 6,500 jobs, which will help address the U.S. aluminum deficit. For 2025, Century projects total aluminum shipments of 660,000 tonnes and anticipates improved EBITDA in Q4.

title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News - Trading Economics
summary: Aluminum prices rose to $2,856.95 per tonne on November 7, 2025, supported by demand in electrification sectors and supply disruptions including a potline suspension at Iceland's Grundartangi smelter and Alcoa's shutdown of its Kwinana alumina refinery in Australia. China maintains a production cap of 45 million tons annually, limiting supply growth amid rising energy costs and regulatory risks.

title: World primary aluminum production growth eases to 1% in 9 months
summary: Global primary aluminum production growth slowed to 1% over the first nine months of 2025, impacted by China's production caps, high energy costs, and other operational challenges. The article highlights ongoing pressures on supply growth despite steady demand.

title: Record Bull Bets Signal a New Era for Industrial Metals
summary: Aluminum prices have surged past $2,900 per metric ton, driven by a forecasted supply shortfall growing from 8,000 tons in 2025 to 365,000 tons in 2026. Primary producers like Alcoa stand to benefit from higher margins and potential capacity expansions, while downstream industries face cost pressures and supply challenges.

title: Investors Amass Record Bull Bets on Aluminium Supply Shortage
summary: Investment funds have placed record bullish bets on aluminum amid structural supply constraints, notably due to China's government-imposed production capacity caps. These caps prevent traditional supply responses to demand surges, fundamentally altering global aluminum market dynamics and creating a tighter supply environment.

title: Alcoa, Ball, and Unilever launch first consumer packaging using carbon-free ELYSIS aluminum
summary: Alcoa Corporation, Ball Corporation, and Unilever PLC announced the first commercial use of ELYSIS® carbon-free smelting technology in consumer packaging. This innovation eliminates direct greenhouse gas emissions from aluminum smelting by generating oxygen instead of CO2, producing aerosol cans with 50% ELYSIS primary aluminum and 50% recycled content, representing one of the lowest-carbon packaging solutions available.

title: Pioneering Sustainable Practices: Alcoa, Ball, and Unilever Lead with Carbon-Free Smelting Technology
summary: Alcoa, Ball, and Unilever are leading sustainable aluminum production by adopting ELYSIS technology that eliminates direct greenhouse gas emissions during smelting. This breakthrough aligns with global decarbonization goals and demonstrates how cross-sector collaboration can scale low-carbon innovations in industrial supply chains.

title: Global bauxite upswing triggers exports, expansions and collaborations across the aluminium ecosystem
summary: The global increase in bauxite demand is driving new exports, expansions, and collaborations within the aluminum industry. This upswing is fostering advancements in aluminum casthouse technology and supporting sustainable growth across the aluminum ecosystem worldwide.

title: Vedanta Aluminium Drives Sustainability with 9 Percent GHG Cut and 1500 MW Renewable Plan
summary: Vedanta Aluminium reported an 8.96% reduction in greenhouse gas intensity since FY21 and announced plans to source 1,500 MW of renewable power by 2030. These efforts are part of the company's broader sustainability strategy to reduce emissions and increase renewable energy use in aluminum production.

title: Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Steel prices fell to 3,029 CNY/T on November 7, 2025, down 0.33% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have declined 2.13%, and are down 6.22% compared to the same time last year. Forecasts suggest steel will trade at 3,039.40 Yuan/MT by the end of the quarter and 2,904.76 in 12 months.

title: US November Scrap Market Trading Flat, Sources Say
summary: The US scrap market is trading flat in November, with most grades seeing sideways pricing. Mill-owned brokers are buying at October levels, and sources expect prices to remain stable to avoid volatility, though some predict increases if steelmakers get busier this winter.

title: Steel Prices in the First Week of November 2025
summary: Steel prices for the first week of November 2025 include rebar at $490 FOB CIS, wire rod at $555 FOB Turkey, and HR coil at $455 FOB Russia. These figures reflect current global export price benchmarks.

title: Nucor Increases Hot-Rolled Coil Prices for Second Week
summary: Nucor raised hot-rolled coil prices by 0.6% ($5/t) for the week of November 3-9, 2025, reaching $890 per short ton. This marks the second consecutive weekly increase, signaling strengthening demand or cost pressures in the US market.

title: Surge in Demand: U.S. Steel Producer Closes Order Books
summary: Demand for steel in the United States has surged, prompting major producer Cleveland-Cliffs to close its order books for December. U.S. stainless steel producers are operating at or near full capacity, with utilization rates exceeding 80% nominally and above 95% in reality.

title: Billions at stake: Chancellor Merz backs European patriotism for steel
summary: German steel production faces challenges due to Chinese subsidies and US tariffs, with EU steel output declining and major producers like Thyssenkrupp cutting jobs. The EU is proposing stricter trade measures, including tighter import quotas and higher tariffs, to protect its steel industry.

title: Climate change and the production of iron and steel
summary: The steel industry is committed to reducing emissions and developing innovative low-carbon steelmaking technologies. It plays a vital role in sustainability through efficiency, scrap use, and enabling circular economy principles by promoting reuse, remanufacturing, and recycling. The industry is also focusing on producing advanced steel products to support zero-energy buildings, low-carbon infrastructure, and climate resilience.

title: SKF presents a novel bearing steel designed to enable the next generation of aeroengine technology
summary: SKF introduced a novel bearing steel that supports faster development cycles and aligns with industry sustainability goals. This innovation is designed to enhance aeroengine technology while contributing to sustainability in steel production.

title: Industry Trends - Federal Steel Supply
summary: The steel industry is experiencing trends such as AI-driven manufacturing and green steel initiatives, which are reshaping the sector towards sustainability. Steel remains a significant contributor to carbon emissions, but innovations are underway to reduce reliance on coal and improve environmental impact.

title: News - Smart Steel Technologies
summary: Smart Steel Technologies has launched AI-driven innovations including intelligent scheduling systems, AI-based temperature control, and slab inspection to optimize steel production quality and efficiency. Collaborations with companies like ArcelorMittal highlight the role of AI in advancing steel manufacturing sustainability.

title: Copper Prices Decline on Fed Uncertainty and Supply Relief
summary: Copper prices dropped as much as 2.4% amid uncertainty about US Federal Reserve policy and eased concerns over global supply. The price decline followed a rally driven by mine disruptions, but expectations of increased output from major producers like Chile's Codelco have eased supply tensions.

title: Copper Set for Weekly Drop
summary: Copper futures steadied near $4.95 per pound but were on track for a weekly loss due to global risk-off sentiment, weak US economic data, and disappointing trade figures from China. Speculation about Chinese government controls on copper smelting projects added to price pressure.

title: Copper prices soars due to mine closures!
summary: Copper prices surged to their highest levels since May last year following a serious accident at the Grasberg Block Cave mine in Indonesia and mine closures in Peru. These supply disruptions, combined with rising demand from the energy transition, have increased market uncertainty and pushed prices closer to record highs.

title: Enamelled Wire: High Copper Prices Constrain Demand, Operating Rates Struggle to Match Year-Ago Levels
summary: High copper prices continue to suppress demand in the enamelled wire industry, with operating rates only slightly rebounding in November compared to October but still below last year’s levels. Demand growth is mixed, with some sectors like NEV and power transformers showing strength, while others like home appliances and two-wheelers remain weak.

title: Copper market price surges with 'animal spirits' reawakening
summary: Copper prices surged due to renewed investor optimism ('animal spirits') amid supply disruptions and rising demand. Prices reached near $11,000 per tonne in early October, driven by lowered mine production forecasts and major incidents at key mines in Indonesia and the Democratic Republic of Congo.

title: Codelco cuts copper output guidance for 2025 despite higher production through September 2025
summary: Codelco, the state-owned Chilean miner, has lowered its 2025 copper production guidance to 1.31 million to 1.34 million metric tons, down from its previous estimate, despite higher output in the first nine months of the year.

title: Lundin Mining Reports Third Quarter 2025 Results and Increases Full-Year Copper Production Guidance and Lowers Cost Guidance
summary: Lundin Mining has increased its full-year copper production guidance to 319,000–337,000 tonnes and lowered its consolidated copper cash cost guidance to $1.85–$2.00 per pound, reflecting strong operational performance at Caserones and Chapada.

title: Glencore 9-month Own-sourced Copper Production Down - Narrows FY Copper Production Outlook
summary: Glencore reported a 17% decline in own-sourced copper production for the first nine months of 2025, primarily due to lower head grades and recoveries. The company has revised its full-year copper production outlook to 850,000–875,000 tonnes.

title: Overview of Q3 Copper Production of the Top 20 Global Mining Companies
summary: Oyu Tolgoi saw a significant year-on-year increase in Q3 copper production, while Ivanhoe's output dropped due to underground tremors and operational suspensions. The top 20 mining companies produced 3,455 kt of copper in Q3 2025.

title: Ero Copper Reports Third Quarter 2025 Operating and Financial Results
summary: Ero Copper maintained its 2025 copper production guidance at 67,500–80,000 tonnes, with Q4 expected to see improved throughput. C1 cash costs are now projected higher due to increased maintenance and freight expenses.

title: Vedanta Resources Launches CopperTech Metals to Bolster U.S. Copper Security and Advance Technology and Infrastructure Transformation
summary: Vedanta Resources announced the launch of CopperTech Metals Inc., a U.S.-based company aiming to enhance America's copper security by leveraging advanced mining technology and AI-driven resource extraction. The company plans a $1.5 billion investment to expand production at Konkola Copper Mines in Zambia, targeting a rise from 140,000 tonnes in FY26 to 300,000 tonnes by 2031, with ambitions to reach 500,000 tonnes annually.

title: Electrification Fuels Unprecedented Demand and Market Volatility
summary: Copper demand is surging due to the global energy transition, driven by electric vehicles, renewable energy infrastructure, and grid modernization. Technological advances like AI, data centers, and 5G networks further increase copper consumption, with emerging markets such as India becoming significant demand drivers alongside China.

title: Rick Rule Copper & Rick Ness Gold Rush Mining Trends
summary: Rick Rule highlights copper's critical role in the decarbonizing world, emphasizing sustainable mining practices aligned with ESG standards. The article discusses copper's indispensability for EVs, renewable infrastructure, and smart grids, with AI drones and ESG technology driving new copper discoveries in politically stable regions like Chile, Peru, and the U.S.

title: BHP's Copper Boom: Sustainable Mining to Meet Soaring Global Demand
summary: BHP reported record copper production with a 28% increase since FY22, driven by strong results at key assets like Escondida in Chile. The company is investing in sustainable mining practices and recycled copper to support long-term growth and the global energy transition, focusing on electric vehicles, renewable energy, and digital infrastructure.

title: Teck Highlights Progress on Quebrada Blanca Ramp up, Pathway to Full Potential, and Value Delivery to Shareholders from Merger
summary: Teck reports progress on ramping up the Quebrada Blanca copper mine and outlines the benefits of its proposed merger with Anglo American. The merger aims to create a top-five global copper producer with enhanced production capacity, operational efficiency, and access to capital markets, supporting critical minerals supply and sustainable growth.

title: Nickel Hits 7-week Low
summary: Nickel prices fell to 15,020 USD/ton on November 7, 2025, marking the lowest level since September and a 2.40% decline over the past month. The market is expected to trade at 14,887.32 USD/ton by the end of the quarter, with further declines projected over the next 12 months.

title: [SMM Nickel Midday Review] Nickel prices fell sharply on November 5 on November 5, once again approaching the 119,000 yuan/mt mark
summary: The most-traded SHFE nickel contract dropped sharply on November 5, nearing 119,000 yuan/mt before a slight rebound. Spot prices for refined nickel averaged 120,950 yuan/mt, down 850 yuan/mt from the previous day.

title: Nickel Market Shows Recovery Signs Amid Policy Support & Trade Tensions
summary: Nickel prices have moved into the upper half of the $15,000-$15,800 per ton range, suggesting a potential recovery as battery supply chains may be entering a restocking cycle. Policy support and trade tensions, including US tariffs on Chinese graphite and deals with Indonesia, are influencing the market.

title: Live Nickel Price
summary: Nickel prices are currently at 15,089.99 USD/ton, down slightly from the previous day. The market remains volatile, with prices fluctuating within a narrow range.

title: LME Nickel Official Prices
summary: The official LME nickel price for November 9, 2025, is 14,830.00 USD/ton (bid) and 14,840.00 USD/ton (offer), reflecting a continued downward trend in the market.

title: First Atlantic Nickel to Attend North American Stainless & Special Alloys Conference 2025, Highlighting Pipestone XL Nickel Alloy Project’s Smelter-Free Processing and Chromium Byproduct Potential
summary: First Atlantic Nickel is showcasing its Pipestone XL Nickel Alloy Project at the 2025 North American Stainless & Special Alloys Conference, emphasizing its smelter-free, low-impact processing. Metallurgical tests confirm high-grade nickel concentrates (1.30–1.47% nickel) with significant chromium content, achievable through magnetic separation and flotation, reducing mass by ~90% and energy use. The project leverages large awaruite grain sizes for efficient recovery and uses established North American mineral processing technologies.

title: Nornickel Announces Consolidated Production Results for 9M 2025
summary: Nornickel has released its consolidated production results for the first nine months of 2025, highlighting increased ore volumes due to the gradual adoption of new mining equipment at its Polar Division. The update provides insights into the company’s operational performance and capacity adjustments, though specific nickel production figures are not detailed in the summary.

title: West High Yield’s Barry Baim on Securing the Mining Permit for Record Ridge Magnesium Nickel Silica Iron
summary: West High Yield has secured a mining permit for its Record Ridge project in British Columbia, which contains nickel alongside magnesium, silica, and iron. The project emphasizes a simple, low-environmental-impact extraction process (drill, blast, crush, and ship), with ore delivery expected to begin mid-2026. The company highlights its partnership with the Osoyoos Indian Band and the project’s proximity to existing infrastructure.

title: Environmental Engineering Researchers are Using Plants to Extract Nickel for Sustainable Mining
summary: Researchers at Stevens are developing phytomining technology that uses hyperaccumulator plants to extract nickel from ultramafic mine tailings and serpentine barren soils, which are otherwise unproductive. This method offers a cleaner, more sustainable alternative to traditional nickel mining by reducing environmental damage and enabling phytoremediation to clean contaminated soils.

title: First Atlantic Nickel to Attend North American Stainless & Special Alloys Conference 2025
summary: First Atlantic Nickel will showcase its Pipestone XL Nickel Alloy Project, which features a smelter-free processing method using awaruite, a nickel-iron-cobalt alloy. This technology reduces energy use and environmental impact by enabling direct magnetic separation and flotation, supporting a resilient North American critical minerals supply chain.

title: Greening nickel extraction requires institutional and financial support
summary: A promising low-carbon nickel extraction technology has been highlighted, but scaling it up to reduce the nickel industry's carbon footprint requires overcoming institutional and financial barriers. The article emphasizes the need for systemic support to make nickel mining more sustainable and reduce greenhouse gas emissions associated with clearing carbon-rich forests.

title: Critical Minerals for a Sustainable Transition Report
summary: This report examines how critical minerals like nickel are essential for the renewable energy transition but also pose environmental and social challenges. It stresses the importance of balancing energy security with ecosystem protection and equitable benefit sharing among stakeholders, including Indigenous communities.

title: Can Waste From Nickel Production Create Better Concrete?
summary: A new study shows that waste from nickel production can be repurposed to strengthen concrete, reduce emissions, and improve sustainable building practices. This innovation could reshape construction materials by turning nickel production scrap into valuable resources.

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali launches pilot phase of green hydrogen project
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has initiated the pilot phase of a green hydrogen project at its Aosta facility in Italy. This move is part of the company's broader sustainability strategy to reduce emissions and innovate in specialty steel production.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Italy's Cogne Acciai Speciali launches green hydrogen pilot plant
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has started operations at a green hydrogen pilot plant in Aosta, northern Italy. The project aims to advance sustainable steelmaking and reduce the environmental impact of production.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Tenaris completes USD600 million First Tranche of its Share Buyback Program
summary: Tenaris announced the completion of the first USD600 million tranche of its USD1.2 billion share buyback program, purchasing 33,059,955 ordinary shares, or 3.08% of its total issued share capital. The shares are held in treasury and will be canceled in due course.

title: Tenaris reduced pipe sales to 2.95 million tons in January-September
summary: Tenaris reported a 2% decline in pipe sales for the first nine months of 2025, selling 2.95 million tons of pipe products compared to the same period last year. The decrease is attributed to weaker demand in key markets.

title: World's top cable maker sees US copper tariff as opportunity
summary: Italy's Prysmian, the world's largest copper cable manufacturer, views the US's planned 50% copper tariff as a positive move that will strengthen the American supply chain. The company, which acquired Texas-based Encore Wire, expects costs to be passed on to customers and is in regular contact with the US administration regarding the implementation of the tariff.
